adverbs.description: wanly (comparative more wanly, superlative most wanly)

entries.meaning: In a wan or pale manner.
examples: Having turned about, he kept his horse to a walk, and at this gait the sleighbells tinkled but intermittently. Gleaming wanly through the whitish vapour that kept rising from the trotter’s body and flanks, they were like tiny fog-bells, and made the only sounds in a great winter silence.
